question_text: Ravi had ______ younger brother who taught at ______ university. He was widely regarded as ______ honorable man. Select the option with the correct sequence of articles to fill in the blanks.

The CEO’s decision to downsize the workforce was considered myopic because it sacrificed long-term stability to accommodate short-term gains. Select the most appropriate option that can replace the word “myopic” without changing the meaning of the sentence.

The average marks obtained by a class in an examination were calculated as 30.8. However, one student’s marks were incorrectly entered as 24 instead of 42. After correction, the average became 31.4. How many students does the class have?

Consider the relationships among P, Q, R, S, and T:
• P is the brother of Q.
• S is the daughter of Q.
• T is the sister of S.
• R is the mother of Q.
Which of the following statements is/are true?
According to the map shown in the figure, which one of the following statements is correct?
answer: The classrooms and canteen are next to each other.
choices: The library is located to the northwest of the canteen.
The hospital is located to the east of the chemistry lab.
The chemistry lab is to the southeast of physics lab.
The classrooms and canteen are next to each other.

question_text: Based on the G.K. Chesterton passage, which one of the following statements is true?
answer: The pocket-knife is described as the infant of the sword.
choices: The author of the passage carries a mirror in his pocket to reflect upon things.
The author of the passage had decided to write a poem on epics.
The pocket-knife is described as the infant of the sword.
Epics are described as too inconvenient to write.

question_text: In the diagram, lines QR and ST are parallel. The shortest distance between them is half the shortest distance between point P and line QR. What is the ratio of the area of triangle PST to trapezium SQRT?
A fair six-faced dice is rolled thrice. What is the probability of rolling ‘6’ exactly once?
A square paper is folded and cut as shown in a series of figures. Which pattern will be obtained when the paper is unfolded?
A shop has 4 distinct flavors of ice-cream. One can purchase any number of scoops of any flavor. The order doesn't matter. In how many ways can one purchase 3 scoops?
Which ONE of the following statements is FALSE regarding the symbol table?
answer: Symbol table is not required after the parsing phase.
choices: Symbol table is responsible for keeping track of the scope of variables.
Symbol table can be implemented using a binary search tree.
Symbol table is not required after the parsing phase.
Symbol table is created during the lexical analysis phase.

question_text: Which ONE of the following compiler optimization techniques uses live variable analysis?
A schedule of 3 transactions T1, T2, T3 is shown. T1 aborts. Which other transaction(s) must be rolled back? R1(X) W1(Y) R2(X) R2(Y) R3(Y) ABORT(T1)
Match OSI layers with functionalities: (a) Network layer, (b) Transport layer, (c) Datalink layer. (I) Packet routing, (II) Framing and error handling, (III) Host to host communication.
g(.) maps A→B, f(.) maps B→C, f(g(.)) is from A→C. If f and f∘g are onto, what can be said about g?
choices: g need not be one-to-one or onto

question_text: Let G be a weighted undirected graph and T its MST. For vertices u and v, d1(u,v) is shortest path in G, d2(u,v) in T. Which is always true?
Given CFG: S → aaB | Abb, A → a | aA, B → b | bB. What language is generated?
Given recurrence T(n) = 2T(n−1) + n·2ⁿ for n>0 and T(0)=1, what is T(n)?
A B+ tree with 5 nodes (max 3 keys per node) is given. The value 23 is inserted. Which of the following is/are correct?
answer: At least one node will split and redistribute.
The height of the tree will increase.
choices: None of the nodes will split.
At least one node will split and redistribute.
The total number of nodes will remain same.
The height of the tree will increase.

question_text: Consider the 3-way TCP handshake: packets P1, P2, P3. Which TCP flags are set?

System of linear equations:
x + ky = 1
kx + y = -1
Which of the following is/are correct?
answer: Exactly one k for which no solution exists
Exactly one k for which infinite solutions exist
choices: Exactly one k for which no solution exists
Infinite k for which no solution exists
Exactly one k for which unique solution exists
Exactly one k for which infinite solutions exist

question_text: Let X be a 3-variable Boolean function outputting 1 when at least two inputs are 1. Which statements are correct?
answer: X(a, b, X(c, d, e)) = X(X(a, b, c), d, e)
X(a, b, X(a, b, c)) = X(a, b, c)
X(a, b, c) = X(a, X(a, b, c), X(a, c, c))
choices: X(a, b, X(c, d, e)) = X(X(a, b, c), d, e)
X(a, b, X(a, b, c)) = X(a, b, c)
X(a, b, X(a, c, d)) = (X(a, b, a) AND X(c, d, c))
X(a, b, c) = X(a, X(a, b, c), X(a, c, c))

question_text: −6 is 1010 in 4-bit 2's complement. Which are valid 8-bit/16-bit 2's complement forms of −6?
Which of the following are TRUE for any binary search tree (BST) with n distinct integers?
answer: Max length of path from root to node is (n−1)
choices: Max length of path from root to node is (n−1)

question_text: A partial data path with RA, RB, and RZ is shown. Which statements are correct about arithmetic ops?
answer: Can do arithmetic using two registers
Can do arithmetic with one reg and one immediate
choices: Can do arithmetic using two registers
Can do arithmetic with one reg and one immediate
Can do arithmetic with two immediate values
Only one reg and one immediate arithmetic supported

question_text: A regular language L is accepted by an NFA with n states. Which statements are FALSE?
answer: L may have DFA with < n states
Every DFA for L has > 2ⁿ states
choices: L may have NFA with < n states
L may have DFA with < n states
Every DFA for L has > 2ⁿ states

question_text: In a C program, a process requests I/O in a loop. How many times will it enter the ready queue?
How many ternary strings of length 5 over {a, b, c} contain at least one instance of two identical consecutive symbols (aa, bb, cc)?
Let f(x) = ax + b for x < 1 and f(x) = x^3 + x^2 + 1 for x ≥ 1. If f(x) is differentiable everywhere, what is the value of b (rounded to 1 decimal)?

A box contains 4 fair coins and 1 fake coin (P(head)=1). A coin is picked at random and tossed twice. Both results are heads. What is the probability that the chosen coin is fake (rounded to 2 decimal places)?
A function bubble sorts array A[0…29] in descending order. Initially, A contains 30 integers in descending order. How many swaps will be performed?
A Min-Heap T stores 32 keys. What is the height of T?
Processor has 64 registers, 50 instructions, 32-bit encoding. What is max number of bits available for immediate operand?
4 processes P1–P4 with given CPU bursts arrive together. Two CPUs M1 and M2 schedule them by priority. What is the average waiting time?
Relational calculus: Players (pid, pname, tid), Teams (tid, tname). Return names of players in team with tname = 'MI'.
A packet with destination IP 145.36.109.70 arrives at a router. Based on the routing table shown, to which interface will it be forwarded?
Given matrix A = [[1,1],[1,-1]], what are the eigenvalues of A^13?
Given F(b3,b2,b1,b0) = Σ(0,2,4,8,10,11,12). What is the minimized Boolean expression?
Graph G has 100 vertices. Max shortest path length d(u,v)=30. What can be said about BFS tree height?
Languages L1 = αβα (α, β ∈ {a,b}^+), L2 = aaa…βαaaa… Which are regular?
Languages L1 = a^m b^m c^(m+n), L2 = a^m b^n c^(m+n). Which is context-free?
choices: L1 is CFL, L2 is not

question_text: Which of the following are TRUE about computing First and Follow sets in top-down parsing?
answer: ε added to First(A) for A → ε
Right end marker added to Follow(S)
choices: ε added to First(A) for A → ε
Right end marker added to First(S)
ε added to Follow(A) for A → ε
Right end marker added to Follow(S)

question_text: Schema team(name, city, owner), with FDs: name→city, name→owner. Decomposed to t1(name, city), t2(name, owner). Which is/are true?
answer: t1 and t2 are in BCNF
choices: t1 and t2 are in BCNF

question_text: Which of the following predicate logic formulae correctly represent: 'Everyone has exactly one mother'?
Let A = {0, 1, 2,…}. Let F be set of functions from A to A. Define (f1 ⨀ f2)(n) = f1(n) + f2(n). What is (F, ⨀)?
A DFA over {a,b} is shown. Which language(s) does it accept?
answer: Strings with even number of b’s
choices: Strings with even number of b’s

question_text: A 1MB file is stored using linked allocation on a 512MB disk with 64KB blocks. Each block reserves 4 bytes for a pointer. How much space is wasted due to internal fragmentation? (Answer in bytes)
Given a 3-address code snippet with line numbers, how many basic blocks are present?
In a memory hierarchy with L1, L2 cache and main memory, each with given hit rates and access times, compute average memory access time (in ns, rounded to 2 decimal places).
Given database tables and an SQL query to select minimum age of players in a team coached by Mark, what value will the query return?
A 5-bit message is sent over a noisy channel. Each bit has a 0.01 chance of flipping. What is the probability it is delivered error-free? (rounded to 3 decimal places)
An IPv4 packet of size 15000 bytes is fragmented over two routers with MTU limits. What is the number of fragments received by the destination?
Given a probability density function P(x) = Cx² over [1,4], compute the probability P(2 ≤ x ≤ 3) (rounded to 3 decimal places).
A finite state machine (FSM) is described using a state transition table. What is the minimum number of states required to realize the FSM?
Given a sequential circuit with D-Flip-Flops, determine the number of distinct states it goes through before returning to the initial state.
What value will be printed by the given C program that recursively counts non-equal adjacent elements in an array?
Two linked lists L1 and L2 are given. A loop in C removes nodes from L1 whose data is found in L2. How many nodes remain in L1 after the code executes?
Given a C program that processes digits of a number by alternating turns, what is the output of gate(14362)?
In a graph, what is the maximum value of x such that the edge (B, C) is always in the minimum spanning tree?
In a double hashing scheme with h1(k)=k mod 11, h2(k)=1+(k mod 7), keys are inserted in order: 63, 50, 25, 79, 67, 24. At what slot is key 24 stored?
